result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:33 PM Defendant DARRYL TEARDIS BROWN JR in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for DARRYL TEARDIS BROWN JR.  Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court states case and notes appearances. 
22CF54, 22CF59, 22CF66 & 22CF244

22CF54
State witness Officer A. Straszkowski sworn & questioned by ADA Zehr
Record reflects identification of defendant. 
Exhibit 1&2 offered & received.
Witness cross-examined by Attorney Thorson. 
ADA Zehr presents final argument.
Attorney Thorson responds. 
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for arraignment.

22CF59
State witness Officer N. Bowe sworn & questioned by ADA Zehr.  
Record reflects identification of defendant. 
Exhibit 1&2 offered & received.

ADA Zehr presents final argument. 
Attorney Thorson responds. 
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for arraignment.

Record reflects identification of defendant.

Bond in all files continued.
Arraignment scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
